visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing timezone-based daylight saving time crossover effects using Highcharts datetime axis with localized timezone configuration
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series with datetime x-axis (ordinal scale) and numerical y-values (ratio scale). Synthetic data follows a perfect linear progression (y = x) from 0 to 15 over 16 days to emphasize the DST discontinuity effect. Temporal alignment uses Oslo's timezone (UTC+1/+2) with synthetic dates spanning the October 30, 2016 DST transition. Data quality is artificially controlled to maintain perfect linearity, contrasting with the nonlinear time label progression. The line chart format optimizes data-ink ratio by eliminating chart junk while maintaining temporal continuity. Perceptual effectiveness is achieved through direct time label encoding and color contrast (red series vs gray axis). Cairo's principles manifest in pre-attentive processing of label pattern breaks. Statistical anchors include the synthetic μ=7.5, σ=4.61 for the 16-day sequence, with intentional discontinuity (+1 hour on 2016-10-30) demonstrating DST impact on time representation.
